Jagoda Pendolska

I am hobbyist programmer enthusiastic about Ruby programming language and Ruby on Rails framework.

This technology stack interests me for a long time (back in 2017 I have attended Rails Girls in Krakow), but last year was the most intensive as far as gathering knowledge about it goes.
Since February 2022 I am taking part in mentoring program Tech Leaders. With my mentorâ€™s guidance I am developing my own application - SH-Cart shopping list generator. This cooperation has significantly increased my skills.

I have completed couple of online courses of Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React and self-taught myself by developing my own projects.
I attempted to join Coders Camp. Despite not qualifying for the next stage the intense preparation period gave solid skills in HTML5 and CSS3. I also got familiar with JavaScript and React.

For almost 4 years I'm working as a BIM Coordinator in EPR Architects - polish subsidiary of the british architectural office. My role is to propose solutions, support, improve the process of creating technical documentation for a building using Revit and automate as much as possible designing process. My goal is to minimize the possibility of making a mistake when creating documentation, to enable efficient implementation of changes to the project and make sure that the created model is of the highest quality. There are many similarities between preparing building model in Revit and software designing. I am convinced that the experience of working as a BIM coordinator is a good introduction to the role of a Ruby developer.

My biggest strengths are analitical thinking, the ability to approach problems, identify them, see what are industry standards and apply solutions.
